meanings.definition: Install wiring in (a building) before plastering or other final work.
meanings.sent1: The electrician prewires the house before the walls are finished.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to prewires a new construction before adding the final touches.
meanings.sent3: Why did the electrician bring a bunch of wires to the party? To prewires the place before the guests arrive!
meanings.sent4: The idea prewires the mind with anticipation, like a hidden surprise waiting to be revealed.
meanings.sent5: The early morning sun prewires the day with possibilities, casting a golden glow over everything.

meanings.definition: Wiring installed in a building before plastering or other final work.
meanings.sent1: The prewires in the walls were neatly organized and labeled for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The contractor made sure to check the prewires before proceeding with the construction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got tangled in the prewires and caused a small electrical mishap.
meanings.sent4: The prewires hummed with energy, ready to power up the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The prewires acted as the silent backbone of the house, unseen but essential for modern living.
